intro: Ardisia chevalieri, commonly known as the Christmas berry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries that resemble Christmas ornaments, hence its common name. It produces small white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered together. Ardisia chevalieri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and berries.
